<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<P>
	Description of Services
</P>
</I>
<P>
	Audit services include the annual financial statement audit of the
	Corporation and certain of its subsidiaries. The fees include the review of the
	Corporation&#146;s unaudited interim financial statements.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Audit-related services include audits of the Corporation&#146;s
	pension plans, special purpose non-statutory audits of divisions of the
	Corporation, comfort letters associated with regulatory filings and internal
	control reviews.
</P>
<P>
	Tax services include tax advisory and compliance services.
</P>
<P>
	Other services include expatriate consulting and other business advisory
	services.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Auditor Independence
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Audit Committee has received representations from Ernst
	&amp; Young LLP regarding their independence and has considered the relations
	described above in arriving at its determination that Ernst &amp; Young LLP is
	independent of the Corporation.
</P>
<P>
	The contents and the sending of this Circular have been approved by the
	Directors of the Corporation.
</P>
</FONT>
<P>
<IMG HEIGHT=65 SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2007/03/26/0001204459-07-000369_SHINET7.GIF" WIDTH=154 BORDER=0>
</P>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P>
	Lynne C. Taylor
<BR>
	Assistant Corporate Secretary
<BR>
	Toronto, Ontario
<BR>
	March 1, 2007

<FONT SIZE=4>
<P>
<B>
	Appendix A&#150;Corporate Governance Practices
</B>
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord Inc. ("Norbord") is committed to following sound
	corporate governance policies and practices to ensure that the interests of our
	shareholders, employees and the communities in which we operate are continuously
	maintained.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Role of Board of Directors
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board of Directors is responsible for overseeing the
	management of Norbord&#146;s affairs directly and through its committees. At all
	times, the Board intends to act on behalf of the best interests of the
	shareholders of Norbord.
</P>
<P>
	Among its principal responsibilities, the Board:
</P>
<UL>
<LI>
	Reviews and approves Norbord&#146;s overall business strategy and its annual
	business plan;
<LI>
	Reviews the risks and alternatives in Norbord&#146;s business to ensure
	appropriate systems or plans are in place to manage these risks;
<LI>
	Reviews and approves strategic initiatives and capital investment plans to
	ensure Norbord&#146;s proposed actions are consistent with shareholders&#146; objectives
	and expectations;
<LI>
	Appoints the Chief Executive Officer ("CEO") and approves the
	appointment of senior management;
<LI>
	Establishes a compensation plan for the CEO and approves the compensation
	of senior management;
<LI>
	Assesses management&#146;s performance against approved business plans and key
	industry performance indicators;
<LI>
	Reviews succession and development plans for senior management;
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Maintains integrity within Norbord by reviewing and
	monitoring disclosure controls and procedures, internal controls and
	procedures for financial reporting and compliance with the Code of Business
	Conduct;
</P>
<LI>
	Approves Norbord&#146;s financial reports to shareholders;
<LI>
	Sets the Corporation&#146;s dividend policy and approves quarterly dividends;
<LI>
	Ensures the effective operation of the Board and its committees;
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Ensures policies and processes are in place to address key
	business issues of the Corporation including financial, environment, health
	and safety, business conduct, pension management and communications; and
</P>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	Approves significant and material issues&#150;in addition to those
	matters that must, by law, be approved by the Board, Norbord&#146;s Board also
	provides approval on:
</P>
</LI>
</UL>
<BLOCKQUOTE>
<UL>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	any capital disposition or expenditure in excess of $3 million
	and for any cost overrun on any of these projects in excess of 10% or $2
	million whichever is less;
</P>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	any new loan agreement or guarantee for an amount in excess of
	$10 million;
</P>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	changes in senior management at the Corporation and its
	principal operating subsidiaries; and
</P>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	any other material agreement or arrangement that is not in the
	ordinary course of business.
</P>
</LI>
</UL>
</BLOCKQUOTE>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">

	&nbsp;

<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<P>
	Meetings of the Board
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board of Directors meets at least quarterly, with
	additional meetings scheduled when required. While most Board meetings are held
	at the Norbord corporate office in Toronto, meetings are periodically held at an
	operating location. This gives the Directors an opportunity to improve their
	understanding of the operations of Norbord.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Composition and Size of the Board
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee has examined
	the size of the Board and has concluded that nine is an appropriate number of
	Directors to be elected by the shareholders. The nominees for the Board of
	Directors comprises nine Directors, including seven independent Directors, two
	of whom are associated with the Corporation&#146;s major shareholder, Brookfield
	Asset Management Inc., and two non-independent Directors including the CEO. The
	Board considers that this combination leads to a constructive exchange of views
	in Board deliberations resulting in objective, balanced and informed
	decision-making.
</P>
<P>
	The Corporation&#146;s Directors represent a diverse base of business skills and
	experiences to ensure effective oversight and reporting.
</P>
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_71"></A>
<P>
	Independent
	Directors&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	seven of nine
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BLOCKQUOTE>
<P>
	Jack L. Cockwell
<BR>
	Dian Cohen
<BR>
	Pierre Dupuis
<BR>
	Gordon E. Forward
<BR>
	Robert J. Harding
<BR>
	Neville W. Kirchmann

	Margot
	Northey
</P>
</BLOCKQUOTE>
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P>
	Non-independent
	Directors&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; two of
	nine
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BLOCKQUOTE>
<P>
	Dominic Gammiero
<BR>
	J. Barrie Shineton
</P>
</BLOCKQUOTE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P>
	It is the policy and practice of the Board that at each regular meeting, the
	independent Directors meet and discuss the Corporation&#146;s affairs without
	non-independent Directors present.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Committees of the Board
</P>
</I>
<P>
	Board committees assist in the effective functioning of the Corporation&#146;s
	Board of Directors. The composition of the Board committees should ensure that
	the views of independent Directors are effectively represented.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord&#146;s Board of Directors has four standing Committees: the
	Audit Committee, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, the
	Environment, Health and Safety Committee and the Human Resources Committee. It
	is the Board&#146;s policy that each Committee meets without management Directors
	present at each of its meetings.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Special committees may be formed from time to time as required
	to review particular matters or transactions. Full terms of reference for each
	of the standing Committees are available on the Corporation&#146;s web site at
	www.norbord.com.
</P>
</FONT>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>

	NORBORD
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="60%">

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Appendix A&#150;Corporate Governance
	Practices
</FONT>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=3>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="10%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="11%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="11%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=5>
<B>
	36
</B>
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="60%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</B>
<I>
<P>
	Role of Committee Chair
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board of Directors has adopted the following written
	description for all Board committee chairs. The chair of each committee of the
	Board is appointed by the Board at the first Board meeting held after the annual
	shareholders meeting. The role of each committee chair is as follows:
</P>
<OL>
<LI>
	To ensure that the activities of the committee are consistent with the
	committee terms of reference;
<LI>
	To ensure that the committee meets as many times as necessary to carry out
	its duties and responsibilities effectively;
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In co-operation with Norbord&#146;s management team, as
	appropriate, to review meeting agendas to ensure all required business is
	brought before the committee to enable the committee to carry out its duties
	and responsibilities;
</P>
<LI>
	To report to the Board at the next Board meeting following any committee
	meeting or upon the signing of a written resolution approving a decision or
	recommendation of the committee;
<LI>
	To provide leadership to enable the committee to act as an effective team
	in carrying out its duties and responsibilities; and
<LI>
	To carry out any other appropriate duties and responsibilities as assigned
	by the Board or delegated to the committee.
</LI>
</OL>
<I>
<P>
	Audit Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Audit Committee, composed entirely of independent
	Directors, assists the Board in meeting its fiduciary responsibilities relating
	to corporate accounting and reporting practices. Its duties include overseeing
	internal controls, reviewing risk management practices, and approving quarterly
	and annual financial filings.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, composed
	entirely of independent Directors, is responsible for the development and
	monitoring of the Corporation&#146;s corporate governance practices. Its duties
	include the identification and recommendation of potential nominees or
	appointees to the Board, and the assessment of the effectiveness of the Board,
	its size and composition, its committee structure and the individual performance
	of its Directors. The Committee also has responsibility for the review of the
	Corporation&#146;s communications policy and its Code of Business Conduct.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In considering and seeking potential nominees to the Board, the
	Committee assesses the skills and expertise of its current Board to determine
	the skills and experience that any potential candidates should possess. The
	Committee seeks candidates through recommendations sought from the current Board
	and Committee members and, when necessary, through recruitment firms. Once
	candidates have been identified, they are contacted to confirm their interest,
	credentials and availability to serve on the Board. Interviews of candidates are
	then conducted by members of the Committee and a recommendation is made to the
	Board.
</P>
<P>
	In carrying out its role, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
	has the following authority and responsibility:
</P>
<P>
	1. Director Qualification and Nomination:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to consider and make recommendations to the
	Board from time to time on the appropriate size, composition and profile of the
	Board;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to establish criteria for the selection of
	Directors, to review and assess the competencies and skills of persons proposed
	for appointment or election to the Board and to submit to the Board the names of
	persons to be nominated for election as Directors at the annual meeting of
	shareholders, or to be appointed to fill vacancies between annual meetings;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to retain search firms for the recruitment of
	Director nominees as necessary;
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage122"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
</FONT>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	NORBORD
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Appendix A&#150;Corporate Governance
	Practices
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	MANAGEMENT
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	PROXY CIRCULAR
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="13%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=5>
<B>
	37
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to ensure that there is an orientation and
	education program for new Directors and continuing education for all Directors
	including making recommendations on methods to improve Directors&#146; knowledge of
	the Corporation&#146;s activities and their responsibilities as Directors; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to recommend qualified directors for
	membership on the various committees of the Board;
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2. Terms of Reference of Board and Committees:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review and make recommendations to the
	Board at least annually on the terms of reference of the Board;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review and make recommendations to the
	Board at least annually on the role of the Chair, the role of the Chief
	Executive Officer and the role of the chair of each standing committee of the
	Board; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review and make recommendations to the
	Board on the terms of reference of the standing committees of the Board;
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3. Evaluation of Director, Board and Committee Performance:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to establish a process for annually
	reviewing Directors&#146; performance, and to provide input to the Chair of the
	Board, who is charged with the responsibility of carrying out such reviews;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review and make recommendations to the
	Board at least annually on the performance and effectiveness of the Board; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 52PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review at least annually the performance
	of each of the Board committees and to bring forward recommendations to improve
	their effectiveness where appropriate.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	4. Code of Business Conduct&#150;to review at least annually the
	Corporation&#146;s Code of Business Conduct and to recommend proposed changes to the
	Board for approval; and
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	5. Disclosure Policy&#150;to review at least annually the
	Corporation&#146;s Disclosure Policy and to recommend proposed changes to the Board
	for approval.
</P>
<I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Environment, Health and Safety Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The mandate of the Environment, Health and Safety Committee is
	to assist the Board in carrying out its responsibilities with respect to health,
	safety and environmental issues. The Committee reviews compliance with relevant
	Board resolutions and with the Corporation&#146;s environmental and health and safety
	policies, and assesses the effectiveness of the Corporation&#146;s environmental
	management processes and health and safety programs including the review of
	internal audits of these processes and programs.
</P>
<I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Human Resources Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Human Resources Committee approves the Corporation&#146;s
	compensation and benefits policy and monitors its implementation. It reviews
	management succession plans and considers appointments of officers of the
	Corporation. The Committee annually assesses the performance of the CEO against
	agreed targets and recommends the CEO&#146;s compensation to the Board. For all other
	officers, the Committee approves the compensation levels. Together with the CEO,
	the Committee reviews the performance of senior officers of the Corporation and
	makes compensation recommendations to the Board. The Human Resources Committee
	is responsible for overseeing the funding, investment management and
	administration of Norbord Inc.&#146;s employee retirement plans. The Committee also
	recommends compensation for Directors.
</P>
<I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord Management
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The primary responsibility of management is to create value for
	its shareholders based on an approved business strategy and action plan. The
	Board of Directors is responsible for ensuring the performance of management is
	adequate and to bring about any management change that will enable Norbord to
	perform satisfactorily. Norbord&#146;s corporate governance principles are intended
	to encourage autonomy and effective decision-making by management while ensuring
	scrutiny by Norbord&#146;s Board of Directors and its committees.
</P>
</FONT>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="60%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Appendix A&#150;Corporate Governance
	Practices
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=3>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="11%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=5>
<B>
	38
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="60%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</B>
<I>
<P>
	Role of Chair
</P>
</I>
<P>
	The Board of Directors has adopted the following written description for the
	Chair of the Board. The Chair is appointed by the Board of Directors. The role
	of the Chair is as follows:
</P>
<OL>
<LI>
	Manage the business of the Board and ensure that the functions identified
	in the terms of reference of the Board are being effectively carried out by
	the Board and its committees;
<LI>
	Ensure that all Directors receive the information required for the proper
	performance of their duties;
<LI>
	Ensure that the appropriate committee structure is in place and recommend
	appointments to such committees;
<LI>
	Lead in the annual review of Director and Board performance and make
	recommendations for changes when appropriate; and
<LI>
	Work with the CEO and senior management to monitor progress on strategic
	planning, policy implementation and succession planning.
</LI>
</OL>
<I>
<P>
	Role of President and CEO
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board of Directors has adopted the following written
	description for the President and CEO. The President and CEO reports to and is
	accountable to the Board of Directors. The President and CEO&#146;s role is as
	follows:
</P>
<OL>
<LI>
	Provide leadership of the Corporation and, subject to approved policies
	and direction by the Board, manage the operation, organization and
	administration of the Corporation;
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Present to the Board for approval a long-term vision for the
	Corporation together with strategies to achieve that vision, the risks and
	alternatives to these strategies and specific steps and performance
	indicators, that will enable the Board to evaluate progress on implementing
	such strategies;
</P>
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Propose to the Board for approval annual capital and
	operating plans that implement the Corporation&#146;s strategies together with key
	financial and other performance goals for the Corporation&#146;s activities and
	report regularly to the Board on the progress against these goals;
</P>
<LI>
	Act as the primary spokesperson for the Corporation to all its
	stakeholders;
<LI>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Present to the Board for approval annually an assessment of
	the Corporation&#146;s management resources together with a succession plan that
	provides for the orderly succession of senior management including the
	recruitment, training and development required;
</P>
<LI>
	Recommend to the Board the appointment or termination of any officer of
	the Corporation other than the Chair; and
<LI>
	Develop and implement the systems and processes to support the policies
	established by the Board.
</LI>
</OL>
<I>
<P>
	Board Information
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The information provided by Norbord management to the Board of
	Directors is critical to the Board&#146;s effectiveness. In addition to reports
	presented to the Board at regular and special meetings, the Board is also
	informed on a timely basis by management of corporate developments and key
	decisions by management in pursuing Norbord&#146;s strategic plan.
</P>
<P>
	New Directors are provided with comprehensive information about Norbord.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All Directors have the opportunity to meet and participate in
	work sessions with management to obtain insight into the operations and business
	of the Corporation. Directors are also free to consult with members of
	management, whenever they so require, and to engage outside advisors with the
	Chair&#146;s authorization.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Orientation and Continuing Education
</P>
</I>
<P>
	The Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer are responsible
	for providing an orientation and education program for new Directors. Each new
	Director is provided with information outlining the role of the Board,
	Committees and Directors. New Directors must, within three months of becoming a
	Director, spend one day at the head office of the Corporation for briefings by
	senior management on the Corporation&#146;s strategic plan, major risks and other key
	business matters.
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
</FONT>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	NORBORD
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Appendix A&#150;Corporate Governance
	Practices
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	MANAGEMENT
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	PROXY CIRCULAR
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="28%" COLSPAN=2>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="73%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="13%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=5>
<B>
	39
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Corporation periodically holds off-site Board meetings at
	one of its mill locations, to provide the Directors with ongoing information on
	the Corporation&#146;s operations. Speakers on specialized industry tropics are
	periodically invited to the quarterly Directors dinners, to provide Directors
	with current and detailed information on the market for the Corporation&#146;s
	product. Directors are advised on an ongoing basis of changes in applicable laws
	and regulations.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Management Remuneration
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord&#146;s remuneration policies are intended to provide a
	direct link between competitive industry compensation and Corporation and
	individual performance. Bonus compensation is reviewed annually by the CEO and
	Human Resources Committee and approved by the Board of Directors. Periodic
	reviews of compensation practices are carried out to ensure management is fairly
	rewarded, based on performance.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Communications Policy
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord keeps shareholders informed of its activities and
	progress through a comprehensive annual report, quarterly reports and news
	releases. A regularly updated web site (www.norbord.com) provides additional
	information about the Corporation, including statutory filings and supplemental
	information provided to financial analysts and investors.
</P>
<P>
	Directors and management meet with Norbord shareholders at the annual
	meeting, held in Toronto, and are available to respond to shareholder
	questions.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord&#146;s investor relations program seeks to ensure that
	shareholder inquiries are responded to in a timely manner. Management meets on a
	regular basis with investment analysts and financial advisors to ensure that
	accurate information is available to investors, including quarterly conference
	calls and web casts to discuss Norbord&#146;s performance. Norbord also endeavours to
	ensure news media is kept apprised of developments as they occur. All Norbord
	communications are carried out in accordance with the Corporation&#146;s Disclosure
	Policy, which is posted on Norbord&#146;s web site at www.norbord.com. This ensures
	fairness, accuracy and timeliness in reporting material information that is
	likely to affect the price of Norbord&#146;s publicly-traded securities.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Code of Business Conduct
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board of Directors has adopted a written code of business
	conduct prescribing the minimum moral and ethical standards of conduct required
	of all Directors, officers and employees of the Corporation and its wholly-owned
	subsidiaries. A copy of the Code is available on the Company&#146;s web site at
	www.norbord.com.
</P>
<P>
	The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee is charged with reviewing
	the Code on an annual basis and recommending proposed changes to the Board for
	approval.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Corporation provides, on an annual basis, a copy of the
	Code to designated employees, requiring them to sign an acknowledgment that they
	have received, read and understand the contents of the Code and agree to adhere
	to same.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All employees are required to disclose in writing to their
	supervisors, all activities, investments or businesses that might create an
	actual or potential conflict of interest with their duties for Norbord.
	Directors are to consult with the Chair of the Board with respect to potential
	conflicts and abstain from voting when such matter is before the Board for
	approval.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All violations of law or of the Code must be reported. The
	Corporation has implemented a whistle blowing policy, allowing Directors,
	officers and employees to report, in confidence, a violation of law or with the
	Code to the CEO or the Chair of the Audit Committee, whose contact information
	can be found on the Corporation&#146;s web site at www.norbord.com.
</P>
</FONT>

	Director nominees are independent pursuant to section 1.4 of
	Multilateral
</I>

<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	Instrument 52-110 and
	are identified on page 35 of this Circular. All members of the Audit
	Committee are
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	independent pursuant to sections 1.4 and 1.5 of that
	Instrument
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.

	(continued)

	Compliant
</B>
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">

	(e)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Disclose whether or not the independent directors hold regularly
	scheduled meetings at which
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: 700">
	&#252;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	non-independent
	directors and members of management are not in attendance. If
	the
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	independent directors
	hold such meetings, disclose the number of meetings held since
	the
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	beginning of the
	issuer&#146;s most recently completed financial year. If the independent
	directors
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	do not hold such
	meetings, describe what the board does to facilitate open and
	candid
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	discussion among its
	dependent directors.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	It is the policy of
	the Board that all Board meetings and Committee meetings include a session
	without the
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	presence of
	non-independent Directors or members of management. In the case of the
	Audit Committee,
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	each meeting also
	includes a session with only the external auditors and the Committee. The
	number of
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	meetings held in 2006 are set out on page 16 of this
	Circular
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(f)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Disclose whether or not the chair of the board is an independent
	director. If the board has a
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: 700">
	&#252;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	chair or a lead
	director who is an independent director, disclose the identity of the
	independent
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	chair or lead
	director, and describe his or her role and responsibilities. If the board
	has neither a
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	chair that is
	independent nor a lead director that is independent, describe what the
	board does
</B>
</FONT>

<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="18%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="71%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	to provide leadership
	for its independent directors.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

	Board Chair and is independent pursuant to section 1.4 of

	The CEO and CFO are
	responsible for providing an orientation and education program for all
	new

	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	Directors. New
	Directors must, within three months of becoming a Director, spend one day
	at the head
</I>
</FONT>

</TD>

<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	office of the
	Corporation for briefings by senior management on the Corporation&#146;s
	strategic plan, major risks
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	and other key business
	matters.
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	The above information
	is set out in the Corporation&#146;s Corporate Governance Practices, in
	Appendix A
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	to this Circular and on the Corporation&#146;s website at
	www.norbord.com
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Briefly describe what measures, if any, the board takes to
	provide continuing education for its
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: 700">
	&#252;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	directors. If the
	board does not provide continuing education, describe how the board
	ensures
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	that its Directors
	maintain the skill and knowledge necessary to meet their obligations
	as
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	directors.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	To provide the
	Directors with ongoing information on the Corporation&#146;s operations, the
	Corporation
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	periodically holds
	off-site Board meetings at one of its mill locations and periodically
	arranges for speakers
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	to present on
	specialized industry topics.
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	The above information
	is set out in the Corporation&#146;s Corporate Governance Practices, in
	Appendix A
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	to this Circular and on the Corporation&#146;s website at
	www.norbord.com
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	5.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Ethical Business
	Conduct
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(a)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Disclose whether or not the board has adopted a written code for
	the directors, officers and
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: 700">
	&#252;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	employees. If the
	board has adopted a written code:
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Board has
	approved, and acts in accordance with, the Corporation&#146;s Code of Business
	Conduct
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	(the "Code")
	developed for employees with supervisory responsibilities, members of the
	management team,
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	and each
	Director.
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(i) disclose how a
	person or company may obtain a copy of the code;
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	A copy of the Code can
	be found on the Corporation&#146;s web site at www.norbord.com.
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(ii) describe how the
	board monitors compliance with its code, or if the board does
	not
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	monitor compliance,
	explain whether and how the board satisfies itself regarding
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	compliance with its
	code; and
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Corporation&#146;s
	Human Resources Department confirms compliance with the Code on an
	annual
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	basis by having the
	Code signed by designated employees.
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(iii) provide a
	cross-reference to any material change report filed since the beginning of
	the
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	issuer&#146;s most recently
	completed financial year that pertains to any conduct of a director
	or
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	executive officer that
	constitutes a departure from the code.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	The Corporation has
	not had to file any material change report pertaining to any conduct of a
	director
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	or executive officer
	that constitutes a departure from the Code within the financial year of
	2006. No
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	report of this nature has ever been filed by the
	Company
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%">
	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	5.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Ethical Business Conduct
	(continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Compliant
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	(b)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	Describe any steps the board takes to ensure directors exercise
	independent judgement in
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 14PT; FONT-WEIGHT: 700">
	&#252;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	considering
	transactions and agreements in respect of which a director or executive
	officer has
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=SMSUYI+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
	a material
	interest.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	Independent judgement
	is exercised by the Board when Directors and/or executive officers advise
	the Board
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	that they may or do
	have a material interest in a matter being voted on, by asking that such
	Director(s)
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="70%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
<FONT FACE=WFCWWO+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
	and/or executive
	officer(s) leave the meeting room, so as not to participate in discussions
	and abstain from
</I>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN=MIDDLE WIDTH="19%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="11%" BGCOLOR="#E6EACC">
	&nbsp;

<I>
	voting on the matter
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=EZFLHW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
	.

	executives

<FONT SIZE=4>
<P>
<B>
	Appendix C&#150;Board of Directors&#150;Terms of Reference
</B>
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<P>
	Role of Board
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The role of the Board of Directors is to supervise the business
	and affairs of the Corporation, which are conducted by its officers and
	employees under the direction of the chief executive officer ("CEO"), to
	enhance the long-term value of the Corporation for its shareholders. The Board
	is elected by the shareholders to oversee management to ensure that the best
	interests of the shareholders are advanced by enhancing shareholder value in a
	manner that recognizes the concerns of other stakeholders in the Corporation
	including its employees, suppliers, customers and the communities in which it
	operates.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Authority and Responsibilities
</P>
</I>
<P>
	The Board of Directors meets regularly to review reports by management on the
	performance of the Corporation. In addition to the general supervision of
	management, the Board performs the following functions:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Strategic Planning&#150;overseeing the
	strategic planning process within the Corporation and reviewing, approving, on
	at least an annual basis, and monitoring the strategic plan for the Corporation
	including fundamental financial and business strategies and objectives;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Risk
	Assessment&#150;assessing the major risks facing the Corporation and reviewing, and
	monitoring appropriate systems to manage those risks;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	CEO&#150;developing a position description for the CEO including the corporate
	objectives that the CEO is responsible for meeting, and selecting, evaluating
	and compensating the CEO;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Senior Management&#150;overseeing the selection, evaluation and compensation of
	senior management and monitoring succession planning;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Communication&#150;reviewing and monitoring communications by and to the Corporation
	including its disclosure policy and a system for receiving feedback from
	stakeholders in the Corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Maintaining Integrity&#150;reviewing and
	monitoring the controls and procedures within the Corporation to maintain a
	culture of integrity including its internal controls and procedures for
	financial reporting, and compliance with its code of business conduct; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Corporate Governance&#150;reviewing and maintaining the corporate governance
	principles and guidelines of the Corporation.
</P>
<P>
	In addition to those matters that must, by law, be approved by the Board,
	specific board approval must be obtained for:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any
	capital disposition or expenditure in excess of $3,000,000 and any cost overrun
	on any project in excess of 10% or $2,000,000, whichever is less;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any
	new loan agreement or guarantee for an amount in excess of $10,000,000; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Any
	other material agreement or arrangement that is not in the ordinary course of
	business of the Corporation.
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>

</B>
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P>
	Composition and Procedures
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Size of Board and Selection Process&#150;The
	Directors of the Corporation are elected each year by the shareholders at the
	annual meeting of shareholders. The Corporate Governance and Nominating
	Committee proposes to the full Board the nominees for election to the Board and
	the Board proposes a slate of nominees to the shareholders for election. Any
	shareholder may propose a nominee for election to the board either by means of a
	shareholder proposal upon compliance with the requirements prescribed by the
<I>
	Canada Business Corporations Act
</I>
	or at the annual meeting. The Board also
	determines the number of Directors on the Board, subject to a minimum of eight
	and a maximum of 20. Between annual meetings, the board may appoint Directors to
	serve until the next annual meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Qualifications&#150;Directors should have
	the highest personal and professional ethics and values and be committed to
	advancing the best interests of the shareholders of the Corporation. They should
	possess skills and competencies in areas that are relevant to the Corporation&#146;s
	activities. A majority of the Directors will be "independent" Directors within
	the meaning of Section 1.4 Multilateral Instrument 52-110.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Election of Directors&#150;The Board
	requires any Director to offer his or her resignation if he or she has not
	received at least 50% of the votes cast at the Annual Shareholders Meeting in
	favour of his or her election to the Board. The Board will evaluate the impact
	of the change on the composition of the Board and accept or reject the
	resignation as appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Change in Personal Circumstances&#150;The
	Board requires any Director to offer his or her resignation if there has been a
	relevant change in his or her personal circumstances, or if he or she has not
	attended at least 75% of the regularly scheduled Board and relevant committee
	meetings in the most recent 12-month period. The Board will evaluate the impact
	of the change on the composition of the Board and accept or reject the
	resignation as appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Orientation and Continuing
	Education&#150;The Chief Executive Officer and the Chief Financial Officer are
	responsible for providing an orientation and education program for new
	Directors. Each new Director must, within three months of becoming a Director,
	spend one day at the head office of the Corporation for personal briefings by
	senior management on the Corporation&#146;s strategic plan, major risks and other key
	business matters. The Directors are provided with information on an ongoing
	basis relating to the operations of the Corporation and changes in applicable
	law and tour the different facilities of the Corporation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Meetings&#150;The Board has at least four
	scheduled meetings a year. The Board is responsible for its agenda. Prior to
	each Board meeting, the CEO will discuss agenda items for the meeting with the
	Chair of the Board. Materials for each meeting will be distributed to the
	Directors in advance and Directors are expected to review such materials prior
	to the meeting. The independent Directors have at least four scheduled meetings
	a year without management present.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Committees&#150;The Board has established
	the following standing committees to assist the Board in discharging its
	responsibilities&#150;audit, corporate governance and nominating, environment, health
	and safety and human resources. Special committees are established from time to
	time to assist the Board in connection with specific matters. The chair of each
	committee reports to the Board following meetings of the committee. The terms of
	reference of the Board and each standing committee are reviewed annually by the
	Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Evaluation&#150;The Corporate Governance and
	Nominating Committee performs an annual evaluation of the effectiveness of the
	Board as a whole, the committees of the Board and the contributions of
	individual Directors.
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage132"></A>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Compensation&#150;The Human Resources
	Committee recommends to the Board the compensation and benefits for
	non-management Directors. In reviewing the adequacy and form of compensation and
	benefits, the Committee seeks to ensure that the compensation and benefits
	reflect the responsibilities and risks involved in being a Director of the
	Corporation and align the interests of the Directors with the best interests of
	the shareholders.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Access to Independent Advisors&#150;The Board and
	any committee may at any time retain outside financial, legal or other advisors
	at the expense of the Corporation. Any Director may, subject to the approval of
	the Chair of the Board, retain an independent advisor at the expense of the
	Corporation.
</P>
</FONT>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>

<FONT SIZE=4>
<P>
<B>
	Appendix D&#150;Board Committees
</B>
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board has four standing committees with specific mandates
	to assist the Board in carrying out its responsibilities. These are the Audit
	Committee, the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee, the Environment,
	Health and Safety Committee, and the Human Resources Committee. In addition,
	from time to time, the Board has established special committees to assist the
	Board in respect of certain issues.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	All Board members have a standing invitation to attend all
	committee meetings with the exception of the President and CEO, who is not
	permitted at Human Resources Committee meetings when his compensation is
	discussed or determined.
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Audit Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The role of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board in its
	oversight of the integrity of the financial and related information of the
	Corporation including its financial statements, the internal controls and
	procedures for financial reporting and the processes for monitoring compliance
	with legal and regulatory requirements and to review the independence,
	qualifications and performance of the external auditor of the Corporation.
	Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining those controls,
	procedures and processes and the Audit Committee is appointed by the Board to
	review and monitor them.
</P>
<P>
	The current members of the Committee are:
</P>
<P>
	Dian
	Cohen&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Gordon E. Forward
<BR>
	Pierre Dupuis
	(Chair)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Neville W. Kirchmann
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The role of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee
	is to assist the Board on matters related to the effective governance of the
	Corporation, to propose new nominees to the Board and to assess the
	effectiveness of the Board, its Committees and individual Directors on an annual
	basis.
</P>
<P>
	The current members of the Committee are:
</P>
<P>
	Dian Cohen
	(Chair)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Neville W. Kirchmann
<BR>
	Robert J.
	Harding&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Margot Northey
</P>
<I>
<P>
	Environment, Health and Safety Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Sustainable economic development is the principal operating
	philosophy of the Corporation. All employees, including all levels of management
	and the Board, must actively participate in making this philosophy part of daily
	decisions. The role of the Environment, Health and Safety Committee is to assist
	the Board in overseeing the commitment of the Corporation to environmental,
	health and safety matters and to ensure that policies and procedures are in
	place so that the Corporation manages its responsibilities in these areas
	effectively.
</P>
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<I>
<P>
	Human Resources Committee
</P>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The role of the Human Resources Committee is to assist the
	Board in its oversight of the selection, development, evaluation and
	compensation of senior management of the Corporation and succession planning
	and, in particular, to monitor the performance of the CEO and to recommend
	compensation for the CEO, senior officers and Directors of the Corporation.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	In addition to the above, the Committee is also to assist the
	Board in its oversight of the funding, investment management and related
	administration for all of the defined benefit and defined contribution employee
	retirement plans of the Corporation and its wholly-owned subsidiaries.
</P>
<P>
	The current members of the Committee are:
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_74"></A>
<P>
	Jack L. Cockwell
	(Chair)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Robert J. Harding
<BR>
	Dian
	Cohen&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

	Margot Northey
<BR>
	Gordon E. Forward
</P>
