<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=6>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT SIZE=6>
	21
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee has examined
	the size of the Board and has concluded a nine member Board allows for an
	appropriate mix of experience and skill and ensures that the majority of
	Directors will be "independent" Directors within the meaning of Section 1.4 of
	Multilateral Instrument 52-110.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Mr. Neville W. Kirchmann was
	appointed as a Director on January 31, 2007 to fill the vacancy on the Board
	created by the passing away of Mr. Don S. Wells on August 21, 2006. Mr.
	Kirchmann will be a Director nominee at the 2007 Annual Shareholders
	meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Board reviewed the relationships
	between each of its Directors and the Company and has determined that the
	Directors fairly represent the share ownership interests in the Company and the
	requirements for Director independence of both Canadian and US securities
	regulators.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Messrs. Shineton and Gammiero are
	considered to be related Directors and the remaining Directors are independent
	Directors. Mr. Gammiero is considered related as the former CEO of the Company.
	Two of the remaining seven Directors, Messrs. Cockwell and Harding (the
	"Brookfield Directors"), are officers of Brookfield Asset Management Inc. The
	Board considers that neither of the Brookfield Directors have a relationship
	which could be reasonably expected to interfere with the exercise of the
	Brookfield Directors&#146; independent judgement. The Board also considers that two
	Directors of nine fairly reflect the relative investment of Brookfield in the
	Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Two other Directors, Ms. Cohen and
	Mr. Dupuis, are trustees of Great Lakes Hydro Income Fund, of which Brookfield
	owns approximately 50% indirect interest. The Board does not consider Ms. Cohen
	and Mr. Dupuis to have any relationship that could be reasonably expected to
	interfere with these Directors&#146; exercise of independent judgement. The remaining
	Directors, Dr. Forward, Mr. Kirchmann and Dr. Northey have, in the view of the
	Board, no material relationships or interests which could interfere with their
	independence as Directors.
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>

<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P>
	Additional Disclosure for Directors and
	Officers
</P>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	To the knowledge of the Company, no Director or executive
	Officer of the Company (a) is or has been, in the last ten years, a Director or
	Officer of an issuer that, while the person was acting in that capacity, (i) was
	the subject of a cease trade order or similar order or an order that denied the
	issuer access to any exemptions under Canadian legislation for a period of more
	than 30 consecutive days, (ii) was subject to an event that resulted, after that
	person ceased to be a Director or Officer, in the issuer being the subject of a
	cease trade or similar order
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
	or an order
	that denied the issuer access to any exemption under Canadian securities
	legislation for a period of more than 30 consecutive days, or (iii) within a
	year of that person ceasing to act in that capacity, became bankrupt, made a
	proposal under any legislation relating to bankruptcy or insolvency or was
	subject to or instituted any proceedings, arrangement or compromise with
	creditors or had a receiver, receiver manager or trustee appointed to hold its
	assets or (b) has within the 10 years before the date of this AIF, become
	bankrupt, made a proposal under any legislation relating to bankruptcy or
	insolvency, or become subject to or instituted any proceedings, arrangement or
	compromise with creditors, or had a receiver, receiver manager or trustee
	appointed to hold the assets of the Director or executive Officer.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As at March 1, 2007, the Directors
	and executive Officers of the Company as a group directly own or exercise
	control or direction over 567,014 (representing approximately 0.39%) Common
	Shares of the Company and over none of the voting securities of any of the
	Company&#146;s subsidiaries. For indirect holdings reference is made to the Company&#146;s
	Management Proxy Circular, dated March 1, 2007.
</P>
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=5>
<P>
	Interest of Management and Others in Transactions
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Except as otherwise disclosed, no Director or Officer of the
	Company, no person who beneficially owns, directly or indirectly, more than 10%
	of the Norbord Common Shares and no associate or affiliate of the foregoing
	persons has any material interest in any transaction within the past three years
	or any proposed transaction that has materially affected or will materially
	affect Norbord.
</P>
<B>
<P>
	Material Contracts
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company continues to guarantee certain obligations under
	operating lease commitments of Fraser Papers, which was distributed to common
	shareholders in 2004. The maximum potential amount of future payments that the
	Company could be required to make under these obligations is estimated to be $7
	million. No amounts have been recorded in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance
	sheet with respect to these guarantees. As security for these ongoing financial
	commitments to Fraser Papers, the Company has the right, at any time, to require
	Fraser Papers to provide a fixed first charge security interest over Fraser
	Papers&#146; manufacturing facilities. In 2006, the fee for providing these
	guarantees was less than $1 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company has provided certain
	commitments and indemnifications, including those related to former businesses.
	The maximum amounts from many of these items cannot be reasonably estimated at
	this time. However, in certain circumstances, the Company has recourse against
	other parties to mitigate the risk of loss.
</P>
<B>
<P>
	Transfer Agent and Registrar
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The transfer agent and registrar for the Common Shares is CIBC
	Mellon Trust Company, P.O. Box 7010, Adelaide Street Postal Station, Toronto,
	Ontario, M5C 2W9, Telephone: 1-800-387-0825.
</P>

</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=5>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Audit Committee
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Audit Committee assists the Board of Directors in carrying
	out its responsibilities with respect to corporate accounting and reporting,
	reviewing risk management practices and overseeing internal controls. The full
	terms of reference of the Audit Committee are included in this Annual
	Information Form as Appendix C.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Audit Committee includes the
	following Directors, each of whom has been determined by the Board of Directors
	to be "independent" and "financially literate", as such terms have been
	defined in Canadian and United States securities laws. The Board has selected
	each of the following individuals based upon their education and experience, as
	same is relevant to his or her responsibilities as a member of the audit
	committee:
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="60%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<TD WIDTH="30%">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Pierre Dupuis (Chair)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</FONT>
<TD WIDTH="30%">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
	Gordon E. Forward
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="30%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
	Dian Cohen
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="30%">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=2>
	Neville W.
	Kirchmann
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Mr. Dupuis is a Corporate Director.
	He is the former Chief Operating Officer of Dorel Industries Inc., a global
	consumer product company. Prior to his appointment at Dorel, Mr. Dupuis was
	President and COO of Transcontinental Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Ms. Cohen is an economist and a
	partner in her own economic consultancy. She is the author of a number of books
	on government, personal money management and social policy issues. She currently
	serves on the board of other Canadian public companies and one other audit
	committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Dr. Forward is the former Vice Chair
	of building products company Texas Industries Inc., a position he held from 1998
	to 2000. Prior to that, he was President and CEO of Chaparral Steel Company. Dr.
	Forward currently serves on the Board of Texas Industries Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Mr. Kirchmann is a Chartered
	Accountant and the owner and President of Kirchmann Holdings Ltd., a private
	investment company. Mr. Kirchmann is the former President and CEO of Coca-Cola
	Canada and Coca-Cola Southern Africa and has held the position of Audit
	Committee Chair on other publicly traded companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	As part of its mandate, the Audit
	Committee assesses the independence of the Company&#146;s auditors. From time to time
	the Company&#146;s auditors also provide non-audit services to Norbord. It is the
	Company&#146;s policy not to engage its auditors to provide services that may impair
	their objectivity or that are specifically forbidden by law or regulation. The
	Company has implemented procedures to ensure that any engagement of the auditors
	for non-audit services receives prior clearance by the Audit Committee. In
	approving any such engagement, the Audit Committee will consider whether the
	provision of such non-audit services is compatible with maintaining the
	auditor&#146;s independence.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	For the year 2006, Norbord paid a
	total of $1.8 million to the Company&#146;s auditors for all services. In 2005 the
	equivalent total was $1.3 million. The following provides details on these
	billings:
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<I>
<B>
	Audit Fees
</B>
</I>
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord paid $820,200 to the Company&#146;s auditors (2005&#150;$830,900)
	for the annual financial statement audit of the Company and certain of its
	subsidiaries. The fees include the review of the Company&#146;s unaudited interim
	financial statements.
</P>
</FONT>

	Company&#146;s pension plans, special purpose non-statutory audits of divisions of

	control reviews.

	services.

</P>
</B>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord paid $73,100 to the Company&#146;s auditors (2005&#150;$40,700)
	for other non-audit services. Other services include expatriate consulting
	services and other business advisory services.

<P>
	Additional Information
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Company will provide to anyone, upon request to the
	Assistant Corporate Secretary of the Company at its registered office, 1 Toronto
	Street, Suite 600,Toronto, Ontario, M5C 2W4:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; at any time when a preliminary short form
	prospectus has been filed in respect of a distribution of any securities of the
	Company, or any securities of the Company are in the course of a distribution
	pursuant to a short form prospectus:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	&nbsp; (i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	one copy of this Annual Information Form and the pertinent pages of any document
	incorporated by reference;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	&nbsp;(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	one copy of the Annual Report, which includes Management&#146;s Discussion and
	Analysis and the audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended
	December 31, 2006 with the Auditors&#146; Report thereon;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(iii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; one
	copy of any unaudited interim reports to shareholders issued subsequent to such
	audited consolidated financial statements;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(iv)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; one copy
	of the Management Proxy Circular dated March 1, 2007; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; at
	any other time, one copy of any document referred to in (i), (ii), (iii) and
	(iv) above, provided the Company may require payment of a reasonable charge if
	the request is made by someone who is not a security holder of the Company.
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The Management Proxy Circular dated March 1, 2007 contains
	additional information concerning the Company including Directors&#146; and Officers&#146;
	remuneration, principal holders of Common Shares and its stock option plan.
	Additional financial information about the Company is included in Norbord&#146;s
	audited consolidated financial statements for the year ended December 31, 2006
	and in the Company&#146;s Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis in the 2006 Annual
	Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	These documents and additional
	information about the Company and its operations can be found on Norbord&#146;s web
	site at www.norbord.com or on SEDAR at www.sedar.com.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX" ALIGN=RIGHT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>

<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=5>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Glossary
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	m3:
</B>
	Cubic metre. A measure of volume equal to approximately
	1,130 square feet (
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<SUP>
	3/
<SUB>
	8
</SUB>
</SUP>
	-inch basis).
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	MDF:
</B>
	Medium density fibreboard. A panelboard produced by
	chemically bonding highly refined wood fibres of uniform size under heat and
	pressure.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Msf (MMsf):
</B>
	Measurement for panel products equal to a
	thousand (million) square feet.
</P>
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Msf (MMsf) (
<SUP>
	3/
<SUB>
	8
</SUB>
</SUP>
	-inch
	basis):
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Measurement for panel
	products equal to a thousand (million) square feet,
<SUP>
	3/
<SUB>
	8
</SUB>
</SUP>
	-inch thick.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	OSB:
</B>
	Oriented strand board. An engineered structural wood
	panel produced by chemically bonding wood strands in oriented layers under heat
	and pressure.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Panelboards:
</B>
	Oriented strand board, particleboard, medium
	density fibreboard and plywood.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Particleboard:
</B>
	A panelboard produced by chemically bonding
	clean sawdust, small wood particles and recycled wood fibre under heat and
	pressure.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Plywood:
</B>
	A panelboard produced by gluing together thin
	layers of solid wood veneers.
</P>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</I>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Annual
<BR>
	Information
<BR>
	Form
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Appendix
	A&#150;Norbord Environment Policy
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="16%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="16%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="19%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=5>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Appendix A&#150;Norbord Environment Policy
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord recognizes that our environment is fundamental to our
	existence, and that our businesses and the communities where we operate depend
	on its health. We strive for excellence, leadership, sustainability and
	competitive advantage with integrity through continual improvement in our
	environmental performance and management of forest land. For Norbord,
	sustainable development means creating economic growth and caring for society
	and the environment, while taking into account the needs of future
	generations.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord will integrate environmental
	protection into our business processes and decisions. Our belief in sustainable
	development means we are committed to:
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Full Compliance
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Comply fully with all applicable environmental legislation and
	regulations that affect our activities.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Forest Management
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Manage forest resources in a manner consistent with the
	principles of sustainable forestry, this policy and applicable
	legislation.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Minimization of Environmental Impact
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Improve our environmental performance as the expectations of
	society change. We shall do this by using forest, energy and other resources
	with increasing efficiency, and by reducing all forms of waste.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Risk Management
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Continually identify, evaluate and control the environmental
	risks associated with our operations. We shall have procedures in place to
	prevent and respond to emergencies.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Environmental Management Systems
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Implement systematic environmental management which supports
	this policy at every operation. We shall assign appropriate human and financial
	resources. Every year we shall establish measurable objectives and targets for
	environmental management and performance improvement.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Innovation
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Support pollution prevention and environmental research, and
	implement findings consistent with this policy.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Performance Evaluation
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Evaluate the environmental performance of our operations and
	personnel, and recognize achievements that support this policy. We shall provide
	our employees with information and training for them to fully integrate this
	policy into their responsibilities at work.
</P>
</FONT>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage175"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">

<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="16%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
	31
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Communication with Stakeholders
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Engage in a constructive dialogue with the communities in which
	we operate and other key stakeholders, taking their needs into account when we
	make our decisions.
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Open Government Relations
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Work constructively with governments and regulators on the
	establishment of scientifically and economically sound requirements for our
	operations.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Audits
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Conduct environmental audits at all our operations at a
	frequency appropriate to their risks.
</P>
<B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Reports
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Report regularly on our environmental performance to the
	management of the corporation, the board of Directors, our shareholders,
	employees and the communities in which we operate.
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Norbord requires its operations to
	develop policies, systems, organizations and competencies, and to embrace an
	environmental commitment consistent with these principles. Norbord requires all
	employees to take responsibility for environmental protection in their
	jobs.
</P>
</FONT>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>

</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=5>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	Appendix B&#150;Norbord Health and Safety Policy
</P>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We are committed to safeguarding the health and well-being of
	our employees, contractors and visitors by creating and maintaining a safe
	working environment.
</P>
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	Beliefs
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=3>
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<UL>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All injuries and occupational illnesses are
	preventable.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Health and safety is a top priority and an
	integral part of our business and decision-making.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Management is ultimately responsible for
	workplace health and safety.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Safe operating practices are a shared
	responsibility among management, employees, contractors and visitors.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employees and contractors are accountable for
	their safety and that of fellow workers.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Working safely is a condition of employment.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sharing best practices improves performance.
</P>
</LI>
</UL>
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	Practices
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=3>
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<UL>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Design safe facilities.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Continually review and improve processes and
	procedures.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Identify hazards and assess
	risks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Develop, implement and enforce safe work
	practices.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ensure all facilities comply with applicable
	laws and regulations.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Provide employees with information and training
	to work safely.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Require employees and contractors to execute
	their work in accordance with legislative requirements and Norbord policy.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Establish and monitor health and safety
	objectives.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Take action to prevent recurrence of incidents.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Implement health and safety management systems
	to continually improve performance.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Conduct health and safety audits.
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: -10PX; TEXT-INDENT: -10PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Report health and safety performance to senior
	management, the board of Directors, shareholders, employees, and the public.
</P>
</LI>
</UL>
</FONT>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>

<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>

<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=5>
<P>
	Appendix C&#150;Audit Committee&#150;Terms of Reference
</P>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<B>
<P>
	Norbord Inc.
</P>
<P>
	Role of Audit Committee
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	The role of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board in its
	oversight of the integrity of the financial and related information of the
	Corporation including its financial statements, the internal controls and
	procedures for financial reporting and the processes for monitoring compliance
	with legal and regulatory requirements and to review the independence,
	qualifications and performance of the external auditor of the Corporation.
	Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining those controls,
	procedures and processes and the Audit Committee is appointed by the Board to
	review and monitor them.
</P>
<B>
<P>
	Authority and Responsibilities
</P>
</B>
<P>
	In carrying out its role, the Audit Committee has the following authority and
	responsibilities:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Financial information and reporting
	&#150;
</P>
</I>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to
	review and discuss with management and the external auditor, as appropriate:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	the annual audited financial statements and the interim financial statements
	including the accompanying Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 90PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(ii)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	earnings guidance and other releases containing information taken from the
	Corporation&#146;s financial statements prior to their release; and (b) to review the
	Corporation&#146;s financial reporting and accounting standards and principles and
	any proposed material changes to them or their application;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Internal controls &#150;
</I>
	to
	review, with the chief financial officer ("CFO"), the external auditor and
	others, as appropriate, the Corporation&#146;s system of internal controls;
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; External
	audit &#150;
</P>
</I>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to recommend to the Board, for
	shareholder approval, the external auditor to examine the Corporation&#146;s
	accounts, controls and financial statements on the basis that the external
	auditor is accountable to the Board and the Audit Committee as representatives
	of the shareholders of the Corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to evaluate the audit services
	provided by the external auditor, pre-approve all audit fees and recommend to
	the Board, if necessary, the replacement of the external auditor;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to pre-approve any non-audit services
	to be provided to the Corporation or its subsidiaries by the external auditor
	and the fees for those services;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to obtain and review at least annually
	a written report by the external auditor setting out the auditor&#146;s internal
	quality control procedures, any material issues raised by the auditor&#146;s internal
	quality control reviews and the steps taken to resolve those issues; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; to review at least annually the
	relationships between the Corporation and the external auditor in order to
	establish the independence of the external auditor;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Risk management &#150;
</I>
	to review and
	monitor the Corporation&#146;s major financial risks and risk management policies and
	the steps taken by management to mitigate those risks; and
</P>
<DIR>
</FONT>
<P>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIR>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage178"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Annual
<BR>
	Information
<BR>
	Form
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Appendix C&#150;Audit Committee&#150;Terms of
	Reference
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="16%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="16%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=RIGHT WIDTH="19%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	5.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Compliance
	&#150;
</P>
</I>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX">
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
	to review the Corporation&#146;s financial reporting procedures and policies to
	ensure compliance with all legal and regulatory requirements and to investigate
	any non-adherence to those procedures and policies; and (b) to establish
	procedures for the receipt and treatment of any complaint regarding accounting,
	internal accounting controls or auditing matters including procedures for the
	confidential, anonymous submissions by employees of concerns regarding
	questionable accounting or auditing matters.
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	Composition and Procedures
</P>
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;Size &#150;
</I>
	The Audit
	Committee will consist of a minimum of three Directors. The members of the
	Committee are appointed by the Board upon the recommendation of the Corporate
	Governance and Nominating Committee and may be removed by the Board in its
	discretion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Qualifications &#150;
</I>
	All members of the
	Committee must be "independent" within the meaning of sections 1.4 and 1.5 of
	Multilateral Instrument 52-110. All members of the Committee must be
	"financially literate", i.e., have the ability to read and understand a set of
	financial statements that present a breadth and level of complexity of
	accounting issues that are generally comparable to the breadth and complexity of
	the issues that can reasonably be expected to be raised by the financial
	statements of the Corporation. At least one member of the Committee should have
	"accounting or related financial expertise", i.e., the ability to analyze and
	interpret a full set of financial statements, including the attached notes, in
	accordance with Canadian generally accepted accounting principles.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;Meetings &#150;
</I>
	The Committee
	will meet at least five times a year and a portion of each meeting will be held
	without the presence of management.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	4.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Review of Financial Statements &#150;
</I>
	The
	Committee will review the Corporation&#146;s annual audited financial statements with
	the CEO and CFO and then the full Board. The Committee will review the interim
	financial statements with the CEO and CFO. The external auditor will be present
	at these meetings.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Review of CEO and CFO
	Certification Process &#150;
</I>
	In connection with its review of the annual audited
	financial statements and interim financial statements, the Committee will also
	review the process for the CEO and CFO certifications with respect to the
	financial statements and the Corporation&#146;s disclosure and internal controls,
	including any material deficiencies or changes in those controls.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Review of Earnings and Other
	Releases &#150;
</I>
	The Committee will review with the CFO any earnings guidance to
	be issued by the Corporation and any news release containing financial
	information taken from the Corporation&#146;s financial statements prior to the
	release of the financial statements to the public. In addition, the CFO must
	review with the committee the substance of any presentations to analysts or
	rating agencies that contain a change in strategy or outlook.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	7.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Approval of Audit and Non-Audit Services &#150;
</I>
	In addition to recommending to the Board the external auditor to examine the
	Corporation&#146;s financial statements and the compensation of the external auditor
	for audit services, the Committee must approve any use of that external auditor
	to provide non-audit services prior to its engagement. It is the Committee&#146;s
	practice to restrict the non-audit services that may be provided by the external
	auditor in order to minimize relationships that could appear to impair the
	objectivity of the external auditor.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	8.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Hiring Guidelines for Independent Auditor
	Employees &#150;
</I>
	The Committee will adopt guidelines regarding the hiring of any
	partner, employee, reviewing tax professional or other person providing audit
	assurance to the external auditor of the Corporation on any aspect of its
	certification of the Corporation&#146;s financial statements.
</P>
</FONT>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage179"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" BORDERCOLOR=#111111 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-RIGHT: 26PX" ALIGN=RIGHT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Appendix C&#150;Audit
	Committee&#150;Terms of Reference
</FONT>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	Annual
<BR>
	Information
<BR>
	Form
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="16%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="16%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" WIDTH="68%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: 1PX SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: 1PX SOLID" ALIGN=LEFT WIDTH="32%" COLSPAN=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX">
<FONT FACE=ACASLON SIZE=6>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<FONT FACE=DOBUDG+ACASLON SIZE=3>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	9.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<I>
	Audit Partner Rotation &#150;
</I>
	The Committee will
	ensure that the lead audit partner assigned by the external auditor to the
	Corporation, as well as the independent review partner charged with reviewing
	the financial statements of the Corporation, are changed at least every five
	years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	10.
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Process for Handling Complaints about Accounting Matters &#150;
</I>
	The Committee has established the following procedure for the receipt and
	treatment of any complaint received by the Corporation regarding accounting,
	internal accounting controls or auditing matters:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The Corporation will make available and
	make known special mail and e-mail addresses and telephone numbers for receiving
	complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing
	matters;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Copies of complaints received will be
	sent to the members of the Committee;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; All complaints will be investigated by
	the Corporation&#146;s finance staff, except as otherwise directed by the Committee.
	The Committee may request that outside advisors be retained to investigate any
	complaint; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The status of each complaint will be
	reported on a quarterly basis to the Committee and, if the Committee so directs,
	to the full Board. The Corporation&#146;s Code of Business Conduct prohibits any
	Director, officer or employee of the Corporation from retaliating or taking any
	adverse action against anyone for raising or helping to resolve a complaint.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	11.
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Evaluation &#150;
</I>
	The Committee will conduct and present to
	the Board an annual evaluation of the performance of the Committee and the
	adequacy of these terms of reference and recommend any proposed change to the
	Board for approval.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	12.
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Other Matters &#150;
</I>
	The Committee will conduct reviews
	and, where appropriate, recommend action by the Board, on:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; the annual information form to be filed
	by the Corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; regular reports on outstanding litigation
	that could have a material effect on the Corporation;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an annual certificate of the CEO
	attesting that senior management of the Corporation have received and agreed to
	be bound by the Corporation&#146;s Code of Business Conduct and as to compliance with
	the Code;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an annual report on officers&#146;
	expenses;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(e)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an annual report on consulting and legal
	fees paid by the Corporation; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=LEFT>
	(f)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; an annual report on the
	Corporation&#146;s insurance coverage and costs.
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE=SELSWW+ACASLON SIZE=2>
<P ALIGN=LEFT>
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
<B>
<P ALIGN=CENTER>
	CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANTS
</P>
</B>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
	We consent to the inclusion of our report dated January 23,
	2007 with respect to the consolidated financial statements of Norbord Inc
	("Norbord") for the years ended December 31, 2006 and 2005 included in Norbord's
	Annual Report (Form 40-F) for 2006 filed with the Securities and Exchange
	Commission.
</P>
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="EFWOEX+TIMES NEW ROMAN PSMT" SIZE=2>
	Toronto, Canada
</FONT>
</TD>

	January 23, 2007

<FONT FACE="EFWOEX+TIMES NEW ROMAN PSMT" SIZE=2>
	Chartered Accountant

<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage182"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="NORBORD0323FORM40F_HTM_EXHIBIT 31_1">
	EXHIBIT 31.1
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P ALIGN=CENTER>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO
<BR>
	RULE 13a-14(a) under
	the SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I,
	J. Barrie Shineton, President and Chief Executive Officer, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I have reviewed this annual report on Form
	40-F of Norbord Inc.;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Based on my
	knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact
	or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light
	of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with
	respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Based on my
	knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in
	this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
	results of operations and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods
	presented in this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The issuer&#146;s
	other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and
	maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules
	13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the issuer and have:
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; designed such disclosure controls and
	procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed
	under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the
	issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others
	within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
	being prepared;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; evaluated the effectiveness of the
	issuer&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our
	conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures,
	as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	c)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; disclosed in this report any change in
	the issuer&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the
	period covered by the annual report that has materially affected, or is
	reasonably likely to materially affect, the issuer&#146;s internal control over
	financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</P>
</FONT>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage183"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 30PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.
</FONT>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The issuer&#146;s other certifying officer(s)
	and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control
	over financial reporting, to the issuer&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of
	the issuer&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent
	functions):
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; all significant deficiencies and
	material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over
	financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the issuer&#146;s
	ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 60PX; TEXT-INDENT: -30PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	b)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; any fraud, whether or not
	material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant
	role in the issuer&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Date: March 23, 2007
</FONT>
</P>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN PSMT" SIZE=2>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 50%">
<U>
	/s/ J. Barrie
	Shineton&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
<BR>
	J. Barrie Shineton
<BR>
	President and Chief Executive Officer
</P>

	Tremayne, Executive Vice-President and Chief Financial Officer, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I have reviewed this annual report on
	Form 40-F of Norbord Inc.;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Based on my knowledge, this report does
	not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material
	fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the&nbsp; circumstances
	under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period
	covered by this report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Based on my knowledge, the financial
	statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly
	present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations
	and cash flows of the issuer as of, and for, the periods presented in this
	report;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX; TEXT-INDENT: -26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The issuer&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I
	are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and
	procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the
	issuer and have:
</FONT>
</P>
<OL STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT" TYPE=A>
<LI>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	designed such
	disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and
	procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material
	information relating to the issuer, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
	is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the
	period in which this report is being prepared;
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	evaluated the
	effectiveness of the issuer&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented
	in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
	controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report
	based on such evaluation; and
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<LI>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	disclosed in this
	report any change in the issuer&#146;s internal control over financial reporting
	that occurred during the period covered by the annual report that has
	materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the
	issuer&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and
</FONT>
</P>
</LI>
</OL>
<HR COLOR=#000000 SIZE=5>
<A NAME="eolPage185"></A>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">

<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The issuer&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I
	have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over
	financial reporting, to the issuer&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of the
	issuer&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent
	functions):
</FONT>
</P>
<OL STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT" TYPE=A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 26PX" ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	all significant
	deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal
	control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely
	affect the issuer&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial
	information; and
<BR>

	that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
	issuer&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.

<FONT SIZE=2>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO
<BR>
	RULE 13a &#150; 14(b)
	under the SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=JUSTIFY>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In connection with the Annual Report of Norbord
	Inc. (the "Company") on Form 40-F for the year ended December 31, 2006 as filed
	with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"),
	I, J. Barrie Shineton, President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company,
	certify, pursuant to Rule 13a-14(b) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
	that to the best of my knowledge:
</FONT>
</P>
<OL STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<LI>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the Report fully complies with the requirements of section
	13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
<BR>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<LI>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the information contained in the Report fairly presents, in
	all material respects, the financial condition and result of operations of the
	Company.
</FONT>
</LI>
</OL>
<P>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	/s/ J. Barrie
	Shineton&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
<BR>
	J. Barrie Shineton
<BR>
	President and Chief Executive Officer
<BR>
	March
	23, 2007
